algorithm_technique: Greedy approach using a min-heap to repeatedly combine the smallest elements.
problem_summary_simple: Combine the two smallest numbers by doubling the smaller and adding the larger until all numbers meet a threshold.
problem_summary_technical: Utilize a min-heap to efficiently extract the two smallest elements, apply the operation (2*min + max), and re-insert until all elements >= k.
key_insights: The greedy strategy of always combining the two smallest elements is optimal because it maximizes the increase in value with each operation.
A min-heap is crucial for efficiently finding and extracting the two smallest elements in logarithmic time.
The process continues until the smallest element in the heap meets the threshold, ensuring all elements do.
